snippet: The Interpol alert added to a climate of heightened concern set off Thursday when State Department officials spoke of possible terror plots against Western facilities overseas.
abstract: Interpol issues global alert to track hundreds of terrorism suspects who escaped in wave of prison breaks over past month, including in Iraq, Pakistan and Libya; seeks help in determining whether operations were coordinated or linked; American and foreign officials believe attacks that freed inmates from two prisons in Iraq were orchestrated by Al Qaeda’s Iraq affiliate.

byline.contributor: Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting from New York, and Scott Sayare from Nice, France.

lead_paragraph: The Interpol alert added to a climate of heightened concern set off Thursday when State Department officials spoke of possible terror plots against Western facilities overseas.

headline.main: Interpol Asks Nations to Help Track Terror Suspects Freed in Prison Breaks
headline.print_headline: Interpol Asks Nations to Help Track Terror Suspects Freed in Prison Breaks
